title: Pyke nerfs any time soon? He is no longer a new champion
body: Sorry but being a hypermobile evelynn stealthed blitzcrank with reset potentional of katarina and forgiving passive is to much

replies.body: the whole thing with a support having a great scaling execute will never be balanced
It can be, but having it reset is one of the factors that's tipping the scale too much.

Ah yes, the infamous “never be balanced” line, just like Zoe’s kit or Evelynn’s permastealth.
Zoe is not balanced. Its not the one shot that pisses people off, its the  "I win lane because I get free summoner spells and item actives" That makes her unbalanced

There are two things about Zoe that are bad designs.

1. Random drops. I'm fine with Zoe using my own summoners against me, but it's just that. **My** summoners, stuff that I've decided to use against her. Not a free Redemption she grabbed from the cannon minion.
2. Artilley one shots. It's toxic on Nid, and it's even more toxic here. Zoe should be somebody who kites you to death while peppering you with passive procs, Q's, and W missiles. I'm fine with being sniped with a bubble and dying because a team collapses on me. I'm not fine with dying because Zoe noticed I fell asleep.

It's a fairly easy fix.

1. Remove random drops. Replace it with 5/7.5/10/12.5/15% item and summoner spell CDR instead, based on W rank.
2. Remove E doubling an instance of damage. In compensation, make it so they can't wake up from damage for the first second of the sleep.

That's not the only thing that makes her unbalanced. The bigger issue is that if you do not play perfectly, and miss a single dodge, you are forced out of lane. There is not enough forgiveness. It's aggravating to play against a champion that only needs to land a single spell on you, that can be cast out of vision. 

I'm not saying she's overpowered, but she is anti-fun to play against, especially if you don't win the draft order lottery.

evelynn's win rate and play rate were crushed because if she was "balanced" she became a must pick in higher levels due to the advantage that permanent stealth gives her

she's still a problem now, but compared to other problems, she's lack-luster and has a busted Q with I think it was 1.9 AP ratio total on one ability if she can land the spike

How is Pyke hypermobile?  Also he's received tons of nerfs and changes.  The whole "he is no longer a new champion" is just a ridiculous addition really.
in comparison to other supports hes pretty damn mobile

Well there are basically like 2 supports in the entire game with any real mobility (the other being {{champion:497}}) so of course anyone who has an unconditional dash is gonna look relatively "hyper mobile".

{{champion:89}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:111}} 

I’d call those “real mobility” as well, each capable of dashing half a screen multiple times in a fight once they get some CDR.

None of these 4 are "real mobility". They each need either an enemy or in {{champion:111}} 's case, a wall to go anywhere. Both Pyke and Rakan have unconditional mobility or "real mobility" with their dashes and speed ups. And since literally every single other support besides those two don't have real mobility, they look hyper mobile.
So you would not classify Xin Zhao, Jax, Lee Sin, Katarina, Yasuo, and Irelia as mobile, since they also require a target?

Xin has one small dash. I wouldn't call him mobile. I don't know why you included this one.

Also I never said that they  weren't mobile. I said that they have no "real mobility."

Here's an example.  You fight a Yasuo in lane and in the river. In the lane he's mobile because has things to dash to. In the river he's got you and that's it. Not "real mobility" but conditional mobility.

Not compare that to Pyke who has a dash and a speed up whenever.  "real mobility."

Yea dude.. I'm 100% for a Pyke nerf, I ban him EVERY single game. (mainly bc im a supp main) and his ult is just bullshit. That's really the only thing wrong with him. Yea he gets a forgive button and gets all his health back.. yea he can do blitz one worse by pulling AND stunning you.  But if you're skilled you can deal with all of that... What you can't deal with, is seeing yourself and your partner get instantly killed when you're both still above 30% of health. A lot of times when you're at Bot lane, people duke it out till everyone is at low health. If there's a pyke, he can just ult you when youre at 30% (as a Leona) 40% if youre the adc... Its the most unfair ult in the game IMO.  You can't have a normal laning phase at bot if there's a pyke around. A blitz, you can still dodge his grab, but thats about all he'll bring to the table. And mind you up until now Blitz was the terror of bot lane, now I seriously rather go up against him than against a bs Pyke. Its just a bullshit ult that needs a BIG ass nerf.

But highly doubt he'll get a nerf any time soon since he just got a new skin and they're not about to lose money on him.

Pyke on the other hand runs around with insane damage [executing champions from halflife] with a kit that at the same time is insane when ahead while being garantueed to be ahead and one of the hardest counters to his assissn archtype, shields, just gets ignored so bad players can feels better about themselves. Or...... you can walk at a diagonal. His crossbones are in the shape of a cross, and face the edges of the map. If you learn to orient around this you can make 60-70% of his ults miss. His ult doesn't kill you as soon as the cross/sound appear. It's about .6 seconds later. Kind of like dodging Nami's Bubble.

If he is ulting you, I guarantee his W is almost certainly on cooldown, and maybe even E. Furthermore, if he misses his ult, he doesn't blink to you, which means he has 2 choices: Be spent on skills and die to the champs he tried to get across to ult you, or try to continue pursuing you and try to duel you at 50% without his ult, with low damage output.

Not be part of his ult means playing responsibly. Not being at a health position for him to use it. Staying well warded. Using turrets as vision.

What whinning parts? win rates dont mean squat. Look at Akali. She is in a 44% & still getting nerfs. Big ones to.

The difference between Pyke and Akali is the skill thresholds to play them successfully. Pyke is pretty direct, cut and dry, doesn't have significant resource management problems, and has mechanics reflected in 10-12 other champions. His Delta is low (deviation from mean rates)

Akali has a high Delta, and is extremely difficult to master.

Low win rates for entirely different reasons. 

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Akali/ World Wide best player win rate 58.3%

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Pyke/ World Wide best player win rate 57.81%

Pyke in these charts is 48.98%
Akali is 46.18%

In other words, the difference between the best rates and the mean rates is 

Pyke: 8.83%
Akali: 12.12%

Skill creates a 3.5% larger impact on Akali's success out of 100.

P.S. Akali's win rates are heavily correlated with Surrenders, as the majority of her wins happen before 20 minutes. Pyke instead has his best win rate at 26 minutes, and falls off after that. Another indicator that proves a skill based champ vs a common champ.

Interesting conversation to be had here about actual power vs. perceived power. I currently have mild debates with one of my buddies about Pyke... I feel that the stats support the argument that he's in a decent spot. However, my buddy maintains that he's awful to play against. He *does* have a lot in his kit, especially to play around. 

Win rate also doesn't encompass other game health issues, like snowballing. Perhaps Pyke is too oppressive when ahead? I like Jimmy Rustles assertion that perhaps he trades too well; this may make him feel bad to play against even if he's "balanced" because he mitigates traditional strategy a bit too hard.

I like your argument, you make good points.

However one thing I must add is when you said, "Perhaps Pyke is too oppressive when ahead?" I believe Pyke has too many options to GET ahead since 
Firstly he has godly sustain via his passive, this makes poke nearly imaginary vs him. On the flip side it's almost impossible to make all-ins worth it since most ADCs by default don't do so well with all-ins early and the risks:rewards ratio isn't favorable unless your bot lane is all-in oriented (Leona, Alistar, Lucian,, etc) or your Jungler has something against Pyke early.

He really has no weakness in bot because of his options, he can escape all-ins and counter with his high dueling power and sustain that takes away moments of weakness. When he is against poke all he has to do is sustain and fish for the damage dealer. So the only option left for the other team are turtle-strats which have been hit with massive nerfs in the near past, and with turret plating as long as pyke can keep enough pressure his side can just peel off free gold. 

That's not even mentioning his ult which is 5-stack darius level insane as an instant and resettable AoE. Darius can't get an execute off a 30% hp target instantly, Urgot's threshold is around 15-20% + non-resettable + is a true skillshot, and Veigar can and is P+C but it isn't resettable either. I really just don't see the logic in how Pyke is "balanced" but that's not for me to decide.
